Class Neuron

java.lang.Object
net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.Neuron
All Implemented Interfaces:
NumberTypeAgnostic<Float>, EstimationFunction<Float>, ScalarEstimationFunction<Float>, TrainableScalarFunction<Float>, TrainableFunction<Float>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ActivationsCachedNeuron, AssociationUnit, InputNeuron, LastInputStoredNeuron
@DomainObject @Entity public class Neuron extends Object implements TrainableScalarFunction<Float>
Represents a single artificial neuron in a neural network.

A Neuron receives inputs from other neurons, computes a weighted sum with a bias (the pre-activation or "logit"), and applies an ActivationFunction to produce its output. The neuron caches its most recent activation so repeated reads are cheap until explicitly deactivated.

Computation

For inputs x₁ … xₙ, weights w₁ … wₙ, and bias b: 
   logit  = b + Σ (wᵢ * xᵢ)
   output = activationFunction.activate(logit)

Lifecycle

  • Before activation, no valid output is available.
  • activate() pulls inputs from upstream neurons, computes and caches the output.
  • deactivate() clears the activation state so the neuron can be evaluated again.

Thread-safety

  • activate() and deactivate() are synchronized to avoid races.
  • Weight/bias mutation is not synchronized; coordinate externally if used concurrently.

  • Constructor Details

    • Neuron

      public Neuron(String name, List<? extends Neuron> inputNodes, NeuronFunction neuronFunction)
      Constructs a new neuron with the given name, inputs, and activation function.

      The parameter vector is sized as inputs.size() + 1 where index 0 is the bias and indices 1.. are the weights corresponding to the inputNodes order.

      Parameters:
      name - human-readable identifier for the neuron
      inputNodes - upstream input neurons in positional order; may be null for no inputs
      neuronFunction - the neuron function to compute a forward signal

      public List<? extends Neuron> getInputNodes()
      Returns the upstream input neurons feeding this neuron.
      Returns:
      an immutable list (possibly empty) of input neurons

      Returns:

    • getInputValues

      public Float[] getInputValues()
      Returns the cached input values used during the most recent activate().
      Returns:
      a snapshot array of input values corresponding to getInputNodes()
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the neuron has not been activated

    • activate

      public void activate()
      Computes and caches this neuron's output by:
      1. Reading outputs from getInputNodes() into an internal buffer,
      2. Applying the getNeuronFunction() ()}.
      Subsequent calls are no-ops until deactivate() is invoked.

    • isActivated

      public boolean isActivated()
      Indicates whether this neuron has a cached activation result.
      Returns:
      true if activate() has been called and not yet deactivate()ed; otherwise false

    • deactivate

      public void deactivate()
      Resets the activated flag so the neuron can be re-evaluated.

    • getOutput

      public float getOutput()
      Returns the post-activation output of this neuron.
      Returns:
      the activated output value
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the neuron has not been activated

    • getWeight

      public Float getWeight(Neuron source)
      Finds the weight associated with a given source neuron.
      Parameters:
      source - the input neuron
      Returns:
      the corresponding weight, or null if not found

    • arity

      public int arity()
      Returns the arity of this function, i.e. the number of inputs (independent variables or features) it expects.

      For example:

      • A univariate function f(x) has arity 1.
      • A multivariate function f(x, y, z) has arity 3.
      • In machine learning, this corresponds to the input feature dimension.
      Specified by:
      arity in interface EstimationFunction<Float>
      Returns:
      the number of inputs (arity) this function accepts
